ygData.subject: Re: Rarely mentioned fact...
ygData.msgSnippet: Our guild is on The Tribunal. Until this past week only 1 of our L50 enchanters had the L49 charm spell. I think 3 do now as we spent the last week doing both
ygData.messageBody:
Our guild is on The Tribunal. Until this past week only 1 of our L50
enchanters had the L49 charm spell. I think 3 do now as we spent the
last week doing both dragons and both planes. If the one enchanter with
charm was on when we organised an fg trip we used that, when he wasn't
we fell back to one warrior tanking each while everyone killed one.

On Tue, Jan 18/00, Dennis Gustavsson <dennis@...> wrote:
> From: Dennis Gustavsson <dennis@...>
>
> Umm, just a little question.
> If you pull 3 giants, why let everyone except 2 tanks attack 1 giant.
> and those 2 tanks take a giant each.
>
> We do it in a totally diffrent way, and I thought Harmonic and
> people he hunt giants with used this tactic to. (since we play on the same server).
> Our enchanters charm 1 giant each and let them along with everyone else kill the
> 3:rd giant. Then we let one go and kill him and keep the other one charmed.
> Then finally we take the last one.
>
> /Wintir lvl 14 bard
> /Thoul 50 necro
> Innoruuk server
>
> jhenders@... wrote:
>
> > From: jhenders@...
> >
> > On Mon, Jan 17/00, kim@... wrote:
> > >
> > > We didn't get a chance to try varying strategies, but I
> > > suspect having one tank (someone with parry and riposte) per
> > > extra giant would save the clerics a lot of mana. Another
> > > option may be rooting the extras some distance away (assuming
> > > they can be rooted).
> >
> > This is the way we do it. One warrior per extra giant.
> >
> > --
